articles.title: Kim Jong Il pays homage to Kim Il Sung
Kim Jong Il visits army unit
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il pays homage to Kim Il Sung
   Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il, together with senior commanding officers of the army, visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on Sunday, the 67th anniversary of the foundation of the Korean People's Army (KPA), to pay homage to the President Kim Il Sung.   
   Kim Jong Il entered the hall where Kim Il Sung's statue is standing.   He was accompanied by Jo Myong Rok, director of the general political department of the KPA= KPA marshal Ri Ul Sol= Kim Yong Chun, chief of the general staff of the KPA= Kim Il Chol, Minister of the People's Armed Forces= vice-chairman Ri Yong Mu and member Yon Hyong Muk of the DPRK National Defence Commission= KPA vice marshals Paek Hak Rim, Kim Ik Hyon, Ri Ha Il, Jon Jae Son, Pak Ki So and Kim Ryong Yon= staff members of the supreme command and commanders of services and arms.   
   Standing on either side of the statue were flags of the Worker's Party of Korea and the DPRK and colors of the KPA.   Lined up there was a guard of honor of the three services of the KPA.
   Kim Jong Il, together with the senior commanding officers�@�@of the army, paid respectful tribute to the statue.
   Then, he entered the hall where Kim Il Sung lies in state.
   He, together with them, paid most respectful homage to Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il inspects military drill
Kim Jong Il enjoys performance given by KPA merited choir
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il inspects military drill
   Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il inspected a military drill of soldiers of KPA units nos. 690 and 946 on Sunday, the 67th anniversary of the KPA.   At the drill ground, he warmly congratulated the KPA officers and men on the anniversary.   Seeing the drill, he noted with great satisfaction that all the soldiers were prepared politically and ideologically and in military technique so fully that they could smash any surprise attack of the enemy in time and defend the socialist motherland firmly.   
   He highly appreciated their successful drill and put forward important tasks.
   The KPA, which completely inherited the glorious traditions of the anti-Japanese war, has grown to be a strong army in terms of ideology and faith, imbued with the spirit of defending the leader at the cost of life, the spirit of human bombs and the spirit of suicidal attack, and a powerful revolutionary army equipped with modern means of attack and defence, he said, adding that the socialist motherland is impregnable and the revolutionary cause is invincible thanks to this matchless army that has been tempered like steel for nearly 70 years of arduous struggle.   
   He gave drill participants a pair of binoculars and an automatic rifle as gifts.
   He had a picture taken with soldiers of the units.
   He was accompanied by director of the general political department of the KPA Jo Myong Rok, KPA marshal Ri Ul Sol, chief of the general staff of the KPA Kim Yong Chun, Minister of the People's Armed Forces Kim Il Chol, vice-chairman Ri Yong Mu and member Yon Hyong Muk of the DPRK National Defence Commission, KPA vice marshals Paek Hak Rim, Kim Ik Hyon, Ri Ha Il, Jon Jae Son, Pak Ki So and Kim Ryong Yon, staff members of the supreme command and commanders of services and arms.

articles.title: Reception given on Army Day
Struggle in South Korea
Multifarious functions held to mark Army Day
articles.content:
Struggle in South Korea 
    Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- The struggle of workers, students and organizations against the authority's fascist suppression is gaining momentum in South Korea, according to a radio report from Seoul.   Workers under the South Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) and at least 10,000 students, their supporters held a rally on April 24 in protest against the South Korean authority's "restructuring" and lay-off before staging a demonstration demanding a stop to the suppression of strikers of the Seoul Subway.   
   More than 10,000 workers among those affiliated with the Federation of Bank Workers Unions under the Federation of Korean Trade Unions held a rally and marched through streets on the same day.Meanwhile, the Medical Insurance Workers Union of South Korea decided to join in the strike of the Federation of Public Sector Trade Unions (FPSTU).
Unionists of KCTU and FPSTU condemned the reptile newspaper Chosun Ilbo for slandering the strike of the subway workers union.

articles.title: Fascist go-ahead for brutal suppression under fire
articles.content:
Multifarious functions held to mark Army Day
    Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- Multifarious functions took place in Pyongyang and local areas on the occasion of the 67th anniversary of the Korean People's Army.
   Youth and students in Pyongyang held a joint meeting with young soldiers of the KPA on April 25, warmly congratulating them.   
   Speakers said at the meeting that Korean-style socialism centred on the popular masses is invincible thanks to the KPA, the armed forces of the respected Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il.   They noted that the KPA has grown into ideologically and militarily strong invincible forces, demonstrating the might of the revolutionary armed forces of Juche to the world thanks to his Juche-oriented revolutionary leadership art of giving priority to the army.    
   Then followed a soldiers-people joint art performance.  Its program included mixed chorus, a dialogic play and  soldiers-people chorus and other numbers.
   Meanwhile, art performances were given at theatres in Pyongyang on the Army Day.
   In another development, leading officials of party and power organs and people  visited headquarters of the KPA units stationed in their areas and handed assistance goods to them.
   Evening galas of youth and students took place in Pyongyang and local cities.

articles.title: President's name shines in world
Pyongyang Declaration supported
"Bill on emergencies in surrounding areas" under fire
Appearance of Pyongyang to undergo radical change
Tanzanian national holiday marked
Greetings to South African President
articles.content:
Tanzanian national holiday marked
   Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun today observes the 35th anniversary of the proclamation of the United Republic of Tanzania (URT).
   The author in his signed article notes with the  United Republic of Tanzania founded on April 26, 1964, the Tanzanian people could take their destiny in their own hands, eradicate the aftereffects of the colonial rule of imperialists and achieve genuine development in all fields of politics, the economy and culture.
The paper says the URT has pursued a non-aligned policy externally and the friendly relations between the DPRK and the URT have developed on good terms.

articles.title: Greetings to Yugoslav President
articles.content:
Greetings to South African President
   Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK,  on April 23 sent a message of greetings to South African President Nelson Mandela on the occasion of its National Day.
   The message expressed the confidence that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two counties which have been elevated to a new, higher stage after the establishment of diplomatic relations would further expand and develop in the idea of independence, friendship and non-alignment and wished the president and his government bigger successes in the efforts for the country's peace, stability and prosperity.

articles.title: U.S. double standard as regards "missile issue" flailed
articles.content:
Greetings to Yugoslav President
   Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Yugoslav President Slobodan Milosevic today on the occasion of the constitution day of Yugoslavia.   The message wished the Yugoslav President and people successes in their work for the country's peace and prosperity and territorial  integrity and expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger.
